title: Ticket #7550: condor_submit mydagfile.dag should generate meaningful error
description:
A very common error is to accidentally call condor_submit when submitting a DAG, instead of condor_submit_dag. For example, user calls the following: 

condor_submit mydagfile.dag

This generates a parsing error that doesn't indicate the user simply used the wrong submit tool. We should generate a better error here. Let's change condor_submit to look for several red flags; if we see any of these, generate an error along the lines of "Did you mean to use condor_submit_dag?". Red flags include:

  • Submit filename extension is .dag
  • Submit file starts with a JOB statement
  • Submit file contains a PARENT statement
  • Anything else? The above are probably sufficient, but we could add more.
